marketNews.title: DPR approves 67 bills for 2026 legislative agenda, including review of State Finance Law
marketNews.content: The Indonesian House of Representatives (DPR) on Thursday, 18 September 2025 approved 67 bills to be included in the national legislative program (prolegnas) for discussion in 2026. One of the laws to be reviewed is the State Finance Law, which sets the maximum budget deficit limit at 3% of GDP and the total debt ceiling at 60% of GDP. Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said he believes the current deficit and debt limits do not need to be changed.

marketNews.title: Economists anticipate more aggressive BI rate cuts after surprise BI cut
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that twelve economists expect Bank Indonesia to cut interest rates more aggressively after an unexpected rate cut on Wednesday, 17 September 2025. The median forecast for the BI Rate is now 4% in 2026, compared with a prior consensus of 4.5% among 21 economists surveyed before the announcement.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Purbaya says tobacco excise tax is too high and vows to curb illegal cigarettes
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said on Friday, 19 September 2025 that the government will pay more attention to the tobacco industry and warned that an excessively high cigarette excise tax is an irresponsible policy. He highlighted the rise of illegal cigarettes and said his team will monitor and combat illegal online sales.

marketNews.title: President appoints Dony Oskaria as acting Minister of BUMN
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto appointed Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises and COO of Danantara, Dony Oskaria, as acting Minister of BUMN, following the reassignment of Erick Thohir to the Ministry of Youth and Sports.

marketNews.title: National Nutrition Board reports near-full absorption of MBG budget
marketNews.content: The National Nutrition Board reported on Thursday, 18 September 2025 that the absorption of the budget for the Free Nutritious Meal (MBG) program reached approximately IDR 8.3 trillion, with a target of IDR 10 trillion by October 2025. The 2025 allocation for MBG is IDR 171 trillion, while the 2026 allocation is IDR 335 trillion.

marketNews.title: Morgan Stanley & Deutsche Bank raise rate-cut forecasts for Indonesia
marketNews.content: Morgan Stanley and Deutsche Bank raised their forecasts for the number of interest-rate cuts in Indonesia, noting that softer inflation and a weakening labour market give the Federal Reserve a green light to cut rates more aggressively.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri 1H25 net profit down 8% YoY, below expectations
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri reported net profit of IDR 11.3 trillion in 2Q25 (-19% YoY, -15% QoQ). The 1H25 net profit was IDR 24.5 trillion (-8% YoY), below expectations at 44% of the 2025F consensus (vs. 48% actual in 1H24). The weak profit was mainly due to a 35% YoY increase in OPEX for 2Q25 and a 25% YoY rise for 1H25, driven by a one-off audit adjustment estimated at 10-12% of the 2025F OPEX estimate. Most of the adjustment was booked in June 2025, with the remainder to be booked in the coming months. Management expects 2025 OPEX to grow roughly in line with the 1H25 increase (+25% YoY). For 2026, OPEX is expected to be flat versus 2025 in the base case or rise low-single-digit in the bear case. Net interest income grew +8% YoY/+7% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, while loan loss provisions rose only +2% YoY/+5% YoY. The bank revised its 2025 guidance for credit growth and net interest margin, while cost of credit is expected to improve thanks to stable NPL and LAR. The guidance cut assumes a government liquidity injection of IDR 55 trillion and an expected 50-basis-point BI rate cut by end-2025. Management says further clarification on the use of the liquidity injection is needed.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea to acquire majority stake in Scan-Bilt Pte. Ltd.
tickerNews.content: Petrosea announced that it has signed a non-binding term sheet to acquire a majority stake in Singapore-based Scan-Bilt Pte. Ltd. (SBPL), a civil-engineering and on-shore oil-and-gas construction and maintenance contractor. The deal will move to due-diligence and further negotiations. PTRO CEO Michael said the acquisition is part of the group’s strategy to grow and diversify into the chemicals and energy sectors. SBPL currently provides maintenance contracts for Aster Chemicals and Energy, a joint venture of Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA) and Glencore.

tickerNews.title: Bank Syariah Indonesia 2Q25 net profit up 10% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia reported a net profit of IDR 1.9 trillion in 2Q25 (+10% YoY, -1% QoQ), bringing 1H25 net profit to IDR 3.7 trillion (+10% YoY), in line with expectations at 47% of the 2025F consensus (vs. 48% actual in 1H24). Net margin rose +24% YoY/+15% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, with net interest margin reaching 5.7% in 1H25 (vs. 5.3% in 1Q25 and 5.5% in 1H24), matching the 2025 guidance range of 5.5-5.9%. Operating expenses rose +23% YoY/+20% YoY, limiting PPOP growth to +13% YoY/+12% YoY. Deposit growth slowed to +9% YoY in June 2025 (vs. +11% YoY in 2024), while loan growth decelerated to +14% YoY (vs. +16% YoY in 2024), pushing the financing-to-deposit ratio to 91% (up from 85% and the highest since 2020).

tickerNews.title: Barito Pacific shareholders receive MESOP share allocations
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific’s controlling shareholder and commissioner Prajogo Pangestu received approximately 1.5 million BRPT shares from the MESOP program on 15 September 2025. The allocation did not materially change his direct ownership, which remains around 71.36%. Other commissioners and directors – Lim Chong Thian, Agus Salim Pangestu, Rudy Suparman, Diana Arsiyanti and David Kosasih – each received roughly 928 k, 1.5 m, 1 m, 1.1 m and 1.2 m BRPT shares respectively.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources to issue IDR 721.6 bn bond for Wolfram acquisition and working-capital needs
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources plans to issue bonds worth IDR 721.6 billion. The proceeds will be used to pay the second tranche of the planned acquisition of Wolfram Limited, to provide a loan to Wolfram Limited for capital expenditures and working capital, and for the company’s own working capital. The bonds, rated idA+ by Pefindo, consist of a 3-year tenor at 8% and a 5-year tenor at 9.25%.

tickerNews.title: Semen Indonesia 8M25 sales volume up 2.4% YoY, market share falls to 47.9%
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia reported a 2.4% year-over-year increase in cement sales volume in August 2025, although the 8-month total remained down 2.7% YoY (vs. –3.4% YoY in 8M24). Domestic sales fell 6.8% YoY, deeper than the industry decline of 3.3% YoY, taking the market-share down to 47.9% in 8M25 (vs. 49.7% in 8M24 and 47.6% in 1H25). Bag-type sales fell 3.7% YoY while bulk sales fell 14% YoY during 8M25.
